section.title: Overview
section.para: The EVAPI module can be used to create an event message flow from Kamailio to any application that can connect to a TCP socket. The remote application can also issue messages received by Kamailio.

There is no protocol definition, it is all up to the author of the routing script. Events can be generated for any event in Kamailio. For 3rd party transaction control, a transaction can be automatically suspended when sending the event, to be resumed at a later point, maybe triggered by an incoming message on the event socket.

section.title: workers (int)
section.para: Number of worker processes to be started to handle incoming messages from remote applications.

section.title: bind_addr (str)
section.para: Local IP and port to listen on for incoming TCP connections.

section.title: netstring_format (int)
section.para: Control if messages on the socket (to and from clients) are encapsulated in netstring format.

section.title: event_callback (str)
section.para: The name of the function in the kemi configuration file (embedded scripting language such as Lua, Python, ...) to be executed instead of event_route[...] blocks.
The function receives a string parameter with the name of the event, the values are: 'evapi:connection-new', 'evapi:connection-closed', 'evapi:message-received'.

para.emphasis: Default value is 'empty' (no function is executed for events).

section.title: max_clients (int)
section.para: Maximum number of clients that can connect to evapi socket.

section.title: wait_idle (int)
section.para: How many micro-seconds to wait on idle, when no evapi messages are in the processing queue.
